Professor/SHARP - School of Accounting

Company Name UNSW Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Professor / SHARP

School of Accounting , UNSW Business School
  • One of Australia’s leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

UNSW Business School is a leader in business education and research in the Asian region and one of the largest Business Schools in Australia with more than 15,000 students, 500 academic and professional staff and more than 80,000 alumni and partners. The Business School offers a full suite of business degree programs at undergraduate, postgraduate, coursework and research levels, including the AGSM MBA programs and a range of Executive Programs. Its direction is guided by a business advisory council of leading CEOs, chairpersons and other business leaders.

The School of Accounting is internationally renowned for its innovative research in several published rankings. It is seen by many as the top accounting research institution in Australia and one of the premier Schools in the Asian Pacific region. The School of Accounting is also known for its high-quality teaching at both undergraduate and graduate levels.

About The Role
  • Academic Level E – a competitive salary will be offered
  • Continuing position, 35 hours per week
  • Based at Kensington, Sydney

Applications are invited for the appointment of a Professor/SHARP (Level E academic) with an outstanding record of research and scholarship and demonstrated leadership and research expertise in Accounting.

A Level E Academic (Professor) is expected to make high-level contributions to research, teaching, and internal and external engagement in the School and to carry out activities to maintain and develop his/her scholarly research and professional activities.

The Professor will also pursue and develop a highly active and productive research program at the highest levels (i.e. publications in top refereed Accounting and related journals, research grant applications, research student supervision, presentation to conferences and publications in conference proceedings).

To Be Successful In This Role You Will Have

About the successful applicant
  • A PhD degree in Accounting
  • An excellent record of high quality in publications in the leading Accounting journals
  • Record of outstanding achievement in providing leadership in a managerial role in a University or professional setting and of outstanding contribution within these settings;
  • Record of outstanding achievement in providing leadership in a managerial role in a University or professional or scholarly setting and of outstanding contribution within these settings;
  • A record of academic excellence with an outstanding contribution to teaching and research at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels including MBA
  • Capacity and experience to play a leadership role in the development of research, teaching and programs relevant to the discipline area and needs of the Business School
  • A strong demonstrated ability for teaching and curriculum development at both the undergraduate and postgraduate level including MBA and a willingness to assist with the development of courses and program review
  • Proven ability to supervise honours and postgraduate research students
  • Demonstrated ability to contribute to the research agenda of the School and a willingness to develop ARC Linkage Grants and competitive grant funding

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application. Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

PD - Professor - Level E - Accounting.docx

Contact

Nikki Hayes, Talent Acquisition Lead

E: Nikki.hayes@unsw.edu.au

Applications close: 11:00pm Sunday 7th October 2018

Find Out More About Working At UNSW

UNSW aspires to be the exemplar Australian university and employer of choice for people from diverse backgrounds. UNSW aims to ensure equality in recruitment, development, retention and promotion of staff, and that no-one is disadvantaged on the basis of their gender, cultural background, disability, sexual orientation or identity. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria to apply.

Payroll Manager

Company Name My Pathway Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 81 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

My Pathway has a rare and exciting opportunity for a Payroll Manager to join the team. Based in our Head Office in Cairns this position will suit an experienced, motivated payroll professional looking for an opportunity to utilize their knowledge and skills.

\xa0

About the role:

As the Payroll Manager you will be responsible for the end to end payroll and reconciliation process for weekly and fortnightly cycles across several companies, using multiple payroll platforms including Micropay. Working in a fast paced and innovative environment, you will report directly to the Chief Financial Officer and work closely with Managers, Human Resources and key Finance personnel on a daily basis. You will also be responsible for managing and mentoring the Payroll team, along with playing an active role in payroll project-based work and process improvement.

\xa0

Your responsibilities will also include:

• Demonstrated experience managing payrolls, payroll reporting and system maintenance

• Highly developed problem solving, research, analytical skills and the ability to develop practical, forward-thinking solutions.

• High level of technical understanding on payroll and HR System integration and workflow methodology

• Excellent attention to detail to ensure that payroll is processed correctly and on time and a demonstrated understanding of the relevant regulatory requirements.

• Advanced level Excel skills

• Demonstrated ability to manage priorities and work to deadlines.

• Demonstrated ability to ensure confidentiality and integrity of personal and intellectual information at all times.

• Excellent written and verbal communication, negotiation and consultation to successfully liaise with internal entities.

• Ability to be a natural forward planner who critically assesses own performance.

• In addition, you must be able to undergo and obtain a suitable Police clearance and working with children/vulnerable people card

\xa0

Your new company

At My Pathway we believe everyone has the right to work and should be provided an opportunity to achieve ethical economic independence; we are committed to developing people, connecting them to opportunities and supporting them to grow. As a family owned business, the My Pathway group employ 1300 staff across 41 locations within the Northern Territory, Queensland, Tasmania and Victoria. Our company is committed to diversity, inclusion and gender equality. We are determined to achieve our Reconciliation Action Plan goals and are proud to be recognized by WGEA as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality.

\xa0

Some of the benefits of working for My Pathway include:

  • Employee Assistance Programs
  • Workplace Health and Wellbeing Initiatives
  • Professional Development Opportunities
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Competitive remuneration

    As part of our recruitment process you will be required to consent to a National Criminal History Check.

    \xa0

    To apply for this career opportunity please\xa0 send your cover letter and resume to applications@mpath.com.au. Applications close 17th September 2018, however we reserve the right to close the position earlier.

\xa0

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander persons are encouraged to apply.

Development Underwriter

Company Name Steadfast Group Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 65 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Steadfast is the largest general insurance broker and underwriting agency group in Australia and NZ. We are ASX listed and boast a significant number of underwriting agencies across a diverse portfolio, and are always on the lookout for energetic, talented in innovative people that want to help shape the future of the insurance industry.


Emergence are seeking a motivated person to join our team located in Melbourne for a Full Time position.\xa0The role has primary and overall responsibility for the business development and sales activities of Emergence in Victoria, ensuring that operational and financial performance, along with predetermined sales and retention targets are met.


The role will involve developing strategic plans and executing to these. The role has a heavy focus on business and relationship development. You will develop a pipeline of opportunities and execute these in line with the strategic plan for the region.



Primary Responsibilities


  • Create and lead strategy for business development in Victoria to achieve growth targets, operational and financial goals
  • Develop strategies in order to achieve predetermined new business and renewal retention targets
  • Ensure compliance with relevant internal and external standards (i.e. guidelines, regulatory requirements)
  • Maintain high levels of internal and external client contact to generate growth opportunities in collaboration with the Emergence team, along with internal and external stakeholders
  • Event management – manage and attend association meetings, trade shows, Expo’s and conventions as necessary
  • Develop and maintain a pipeline of business development and leads through identification and connection of new partnerships and the development of new markets
  • Support the gathering of market intelligence on competitor offerings, sales strategies, new products, sales campaigns and events
  • Regular reporting on actual performance to budget, with variance analysis and revision projections
  • Build strong partnerships with stakeholders within the business in order to improve collaboration, identify opportunities to improve services and ensure client satisfaction
  • Participate in Presentations to the market as required
  • Resolution of issues with partners as and when they occur
  • Product and Portal training delivered to partners
  • Support the creation and frequent delivery of newsletters, blogs and webinars to the market
  • Promotion of existing organisational products, and the identification of new product opportunities
  • Deal with the day to day requests from brokers and administrative tasks
  • Other duties as assigned\xa0

\xa0

What we are looking for

\xa0

  • You are keen to role your sleeves up, learn & solve problems
  • You are always looking for ways to help
  • You enjoy building and fostering partnerships
  • You can work autonomously

\xa0

Skills and Competencies

  • Can have a business or technology background
  • Preparing and presenting technical reports, analysis and documents
  • Undergoing training either formally or informally on a regular basis
  • Contributing to team projects
  • Manage workload within specific timelines

\xa0

With support from the Emergence Team, the opportunity will quickly develop the following;

  • Working knowledge of cyber insurance products
  • Understanding and exposure to various functions within an insurance company – (underwriting, claims, product development, finance, marketing and sales)
  • Sound skills in negotiation, communication and relationship management
  • Ability to develop rapport, listen and deal with queries from brokers, clients and staff

Qualifications and Key skills

\xa0

  • Can come from a business or technology background
  • Working towards (or have obtained) tertiary qualifications
  • Working towards (or have obtained) Tier 1 accreditation
  • Developing communication. organisational, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Developing technical capability



Candidates with rights to work in Australia need only apply.

UX/UI Designer

Company Name World Vision Australia Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 141 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity to Make a Difference:


The purpose of this role is to support the Senior UX/UI Designer on a number of digital projects and digital products that support World Vision Australia to successfully fundraise in the digital space, and to engage and retain supporters.


\xa0


A day in the life of WVA’s UX/UI Designer includes:


You will be in charge to:


  • Manage the WVA website and content & develop and design new website pages as required
  • Develop and design new wireframes, user-flows and prototypes
  • Analyse, review and report on effectiveness of designs\xa0
  • Stakeholder management and requirement gathering

\xa0


Who are you?


  • 2-5\xa0years in a digital technical environment
  • Agile experience and understanding of scrum
  • Ability to use Adobe Creative Cloud/Suite,
  • Working knowledge of HTML and LESS(CSS), Javascript etc
  • Familiar with GIT
  • Fluent in all design tools- Photoshop, Illustrator and other design tools
  • Front end development skills
  • Strong web based digital design capability
  • Strong knowledge of wire framing or prototyping tools and workflow models
  • Mobile design and development
  • The ability to learn and manage a custom CMS (Sitefinity)
  • UX & ecommerce design
  • Enthusiastic and positive attitude, and a proactive approach to all tasks
  • Social media savvy
  • Up to date knowledge of the latest design trends
  • Demonstrable ability to display initiative, take responsibility for projects and show a proactive attitude
  • Flexible and ability to manage changing priorities.
  • An ability to work autonomously and self-motivate

\xa0


This role is\xa0a\xa03 months fixed term\xa0contract operating in a part-time capacity (22.5h/w) and will be based at our head office in Burwood East, Victoria.


\xa0


What does success look like?


First and foremost, you will be a leader in every aspect of your life and line of work, irrespective of your level of expertise. You excel working in an ever-changing environment and you love forming strong relationships, which lets you effectively engage with stakeholders and to perform at your peak.


Having a proactive and fresh approach, you are ready to collaborate and overcome any obstacles that may come your way. Your energy is infectious, showcasing the passion you can bring to our organisation.


\xa0


Why Should You Apply?


  • We collaborate in a high performing and professional culture, committed to one common goal; the fight against global poverty, its causes and making a real difference in the world
  • We build brighter futures for vulnerable children and seeking to empower the world's poorest people.
  • Our people have access to professional development programs that include on-the-job learning, e-learning, workshops, forums, leadership development and internal mobility
  • Competitive salary and flexible salary packaging scheme

\xa0


Why World Vision?


World Vision is a worldwide community development organisation that provides short-term and long-term assistance to 100 million people worldwide (including 2.4 million children).


We have more than 45,000 staff members working in 96 countries. For six decades, World Vision has been engaging people to work towards eliminating poverty and its causes.


Our vision for every child: Life in all its fullness. Our prayer for every heart: the will to make it so

851691398:
[

Lawyer (Commercial Disputes)

Company Name Lander & Rogers Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 98 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Lander & Rogers is a leading independent Australian law firm operating nationally from Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane. We are a principal advisor to many publicly listed and private Australian companies, Australian subsidiaries of global companies, as well as all levels of government.

We have nearly 500 people nationally, seven key areas of practice, and cover a diverse range of industry sectors, with a core focus on financial services, insurance, government, infrastructure, real estate, and retail and supply chain.

We are consistently independently rated by our clients as a top performing law firm in Australia — our client feedback led to us being named a finalist for Best Law Firm (revenue $50m - $200m) in the 2017 Financial Review Client Choice Awards, having won this award and Best Professional Services Firm (revenue $50m-$200m) at the 2016 awards.

Our firm believes that legal services are much more than just the law — they are about great people, sustained excellence, and exceptional client service. We have a reputation in the legal market as a provider of premium legal services, and as a sought-after employer. We are renowned in Australia for our down-to-earth and supportive workplace culture.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We are highly regarded as a leading litigation and dispute resolution practice. We believe that disputes should not take on a life of their own but should be resolved within our clients' broader commercial and/or statutory context. Our approach is to develop strategies to facilitate the prompt resolution of disputes, including alternative dispute resolution (ADR), to achieve cost-effective results.

Our team acts in a wide range of courts and tribunals nationally in matters such as contractual disputes, directors and trustee liability, shareholder and corporation's disputes, financial services disputes, environmental disputes, fraud claims, insolvency and bankruptcy, major class actions, professional negligence claims, regulatory matters, commissions of inquiry, property and leasing disputes.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The firm has experienced considerable growth in recent years and now has an exciting opportunity available for a\xa0Lawyer\xa0to join its\xa0Commercial Disputes\xa0group in\xa0Melbourne.\xa0

ABOUT YOU

To be successful in this role you will have 2-3 years' post-admission litigation experience ideally within commercial disputes.\xa0 You will be a self-starter, confident appearing in court\xa0and have a strong technical skills base.\xa0 Fitting into our down to earth, friendly and collegiate but high performing culture is important and as such an energetic and collaborative approach is essential.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER

This is a diverse role and\xa0presents an excellent opportunity to join an established and successful firm with a down to earth and unique culture, with an ability to develop specialist skills as your career develops. In return for your hard work, enthusiasm and excellent technical skills, you will have the opportunity to work with recognised leaders in the litigation and commercial law space. You will be part of a growing team with excellent career progression prospects and enjoy a supportive environment in a firm renowned for its unique culture.

If you are interested in joining our Commercial Disputes\xa0group, please submit your CV and academic transcript by clicking the 'Apply' button.

For more information about Lander & Rogers please see our website\xa0www.landers.com.au

Industry

  • Law Practice
